design_audit.model_formula: d_ln_real_earn_win1 ~ d_computer_2017_2007_n_s1 + d_share_emp_2017_2007_n_s1 + i_computer_2007_n_s1 + i_male + controls [aw=dwsuppwt] | year + year_job_loss, cluster(dwsoc4)
design_audit.selection_story: Cross-occupation variation in technological change (measured by changes in computer/software requirements in job postings from Burning Glass 2007-2017) predicts earnings losses among displaced workers

claim_object.outcome_concept: Change in log real weekly earnings after displacement (winsorized at 2.5th/97.5th percentile)
claim_object.treatment_concept: Occupation-level change in computer and software requirements (d_computer_2017_2007), normalized to standard-deviation units
claim_object.estimand_concept: Effect of occupation-level technological change on post-displacement earnings losses
claim_object.target_population: Displaced workers in CPS Displaced Worker Supplement (2010-2018), age 25-65, with real earnings >= $100 at both pre- and post-displacement jobs, not top-coded

baseline_specs.label: Table3-Col2-SOC4
baseline_specs.sample_restriction: samp_1 == 1 (employed sample, age 25-65, earnings >= 100, not top-coded, job loss year >= 2007)
baseline_specs.notes: Table 3 Column 2 (normalized, with employment share control). Key treatment variable is d_computer_2017_2007_n_s1 (change in computer/software requirements, 2007-2017, normalized). SOC-4 digit occupation codes.

constraints.functional_form_policy: Treatment variable is normalized to SD units. Outcome is winsorized change in log real earnings. The winsorization at 2.5% is part of the data construction; alternative winsorization percentiles are a natural robustness check.
constraints.occupation_code_note: Paper uses two occupation classification systems: SOC-4 digit and Autor-Dorn (AD). The AD codes are an alternative coding of the same data. AD regressions use different treatment/control variables (d_computer_2017_2007_AD_n_s1, d_share_emp_2017_2007_AD_n_s1, i_computer_AD_2007_n_s1) and cluster at dwocc1990dd instead of dwsoc4. The normalization is also recomputed within the AD sample.
constraints.normalization_note: Treatment and occupation-level controls are normalized to SD units within the analysis sample (samp_1). For full-time-only specs (Table 3 Col 3), normalization is recomputed within the full-time subsample (_n_s1_ft suffix). The runner must replicate this sample-specific normalization.
constraints.winsorization_note: Outcome d_ln_real_earn_win1 is winsorized at 2.5th/97.5th percentile within samp_1 using Stata's winsor command. Alternative winsorization rc specs should also winsorize within the analysis sample.

canonical.notes: Cluster at 4-digit SOC occupation level, matching paper's vce(cluster dwsoc4)
